resources.string: Welcome! We are going to take a quick view at the UI components that make up Android apps.

-Android is an open-source operating system that is based in Linux\n-Though the open-source nature of Android, the most widely used version is maintained by Google\n-It is the most widely used mobile operating system
-Java was the original language used\n-Kotlin is now the preferred language by Google, however Java is still used
-All major updates are named after desserts and in alphabetical order\n-This version\'s name is Tiramisu!
-XML stands for extensible markup language\n-Used for storing data
How is it used in Android?
-Used to create content on Android Activities\n-Stores information such as color, strings, and images to be called

-We are in one right now!
-Refers to the screen layouts (pages)
-Each time we hit [Next!] we are moving to a new activity
-There are two types of activities, landscape and portrait
-This is landscape view
-Colors and string values are called from a separate XML
